summary: Barbara L. Mosley was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS). She appears in payroll and certification reports from April 1978 to December 1978. These documents list her as an employee, along with her salary and pay information during that period. The documents do not specify her exact role within the committee, but her presence on payroll indicates she was a staff member.
significance: Barbara L. Mosley's significance lies in her employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations, indicating her involvement in the investigation of the JFK assassination, although the specific nature and extent of her contribution are not detailed in these documents.
